devdoc.details: This contract buying and spending reactions

CreatorRewardsGranted(address,address,ui.details: Event emitted when rewards are granted to a creator

ERC20RewardsClaimed(address,uint256,addr.details: Event emitted when an account withdraws ERC20 rewards

MakerRewardsGranted(address,address,uint.details: Event emitted when rewards are granted to a maker

ReactionsPurchased(uint256,uint256,addre.details: Event emitted when a reaction is purchased

ReactionsSpent(uint256,address,uint256,u.details: Event emitted when reaction is spent

ReferrerRewardsGranted(address,address,u.details: Event emitted when rewards are granted to a referrer

TakerWithdraw(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Event emitted when taker claims curator tokens

buyAndSpendReaction(uint256,uint256,addr.details: Allows a user to buy and spend a reaction in 1 transaction instead of first buying and then spending in 2 separate transactions

buyReaction(uint256,uint256,address,addr.details: External func to allow a user to buy reaction NFTs based on a registered Maker NFT

params.destinationWallet: reactions will be minted into this wallet (allows bulk buying from other contracts since reactions are non-transferrable)
params.optionBits: Optional param to specify options how the user wants transform reaction
params.referrer: Optional param to specify an address where referrer rewards are allocated

deriveParameterVersion(address).details: Derive the pricing parameters version E.g. if the price of a reaction changes, the paramaterVersion should be different

deriveReactionId(uint256,uint256,uint256.details: Derive the reaction ID from the parameters This unique ID will be used to track instances of reactions built from the same params E.g. if the price of a reaction changes, the reaction ID should be different

initialize(address).details: initializer to call after deployment, can only be called once

spendReaction(uint256,address,uint256,ui.details: Allows a reaction NFT owner to spend (burn) their tokens at a specific target Taker NFT.

params.curatorVaultOverride: Optional address of non-default curator vault
params.ipfsMetadataHash: Optional hash of any metadata being associated with spend action
params.referrer: Optional address where referrer rewards are allocated
params.takerNftAddress: Target contract where the reaction is targeting
params.takerNftChainId: Chain ID where the NFT lives
params.takerNftId: Target NFT ID in the contract

withdrawErc20Rewards(address).details: Allows an account that has been allocated rewards to withdraw (Maker, creator, referrer)

params.token: ERC20 token that rewards are valued in

withdrawTakerRewards(uint256,address,uin.details: Allows an NFT taker to withdraw rewards for reactions that were spent against an NFT that they own. The owner of the NFT must register the NFT into the system before they can claim the rewards.

devdoc.title: ReactionVault

devdoc.details: This contract implements a proxy that is upgradeable by an admin.  To avoid https://medium.com/nomic-labs-blog/malicious-backdoors-in-ethereum-proxies-62629adf3357[proxy selector clashing], which can potentially be used in an attack, this contract uses the https://blog.openzeppelin.com/the-transparent-proxy-pattern/[transparent proxy pattern]. This pattern implies two things that go hand in hand:  1. If any account other than the admin calls the proxy, the call will be forwarded to the implementation, even if that call matches one of the admin functions exposed by the proxy itself. 2. If the admin calls the proxy, it can access the admin functions, but its calls will never be forwarded to the implementation. If the admin tries to call a function on the implementation it will fail with an error that says "admin cannot fallback to proxy target".  These properties mean that the admin account can only be used for admin actions like upgrading the proxy or changing the admin, so it's best if it's a dedicated account that is not used for anything else. This will avoid headaches due to sudden errors when trying to call a function from the proxy implementation.  Our recommendation is for the dedicated account to be an instance of the {ProxyAdmin} contract. If set up this way, you should think of the `ProxyAdmin` instance as the real administrative inerface of your proxy.

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

admin().details: Returns the current admin.  NOTE: Only the admin can call this function. See {ProxyAdmin-getProxyAdmin}.  TIP: To get this value clients can read directly from the storage slot shown below (specified by EIP1967) using the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_getstorageat[`eth_getStorageAt`] RPC call. `0xb53127684a568b3173ae13b9f8a6016e243e63b6e8ee1178d6a717850b5d6103`

changeAdmin(address).details: Changes the admin of the proxy.  Emits an {AdminChanged} event.  NOTE: Only the admin can call this function. See {ProxyAdmin-changeProxyAdmin}.

constructor.details: Initializes an upgradeable proxy managed by `_admin`, backed by the implementation at `_logic`, and optionally initialized with `_data` as explained in {UpgradeableProxy-constructor}.

implementation().details: Returns the current implementation.  NOTE: Only the admin can call this function. See {ProxyAdmin-getProxyImplementation}.  TIP: To get this value clients can read directly from the storage slot shown below (specified by EIP1967) using the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_getstorageat[`eth_getStorageAt`] RPC call. `0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc`

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy.  NOTE: Only the admin can call this function. See {ProxyAdmin-upgrade}.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy, and then call a function from the new implementation as specified by `data`, which should be an encoded function call. This is useful to initialize new storage variables in the proxied contract.  NOTE: Only the admin can call this function. See {ProxyAdmin-upgradeAndCall}.

_ADMIN_SLOT.details: Storage slot with the admin of the contract. This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.admin" subtracted by 1, and is validated in the constructor.
